definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: The added value of marriage is also hard to kick.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻的附加值也是不容易踢翻的。

sentences.english: Can a character who takes this feat stack the armor bonus from bracers of armor with Inertial Armor?
sentences.chinese: 人物可以将防御护腕的盔甲加值和该专长累计么？

sentences.english: However, you design an extension field into the schema to accommodate additional values.
sentences.chinese: 然而，您要在模式中设计一个扩展字段来容纳附加值。

sentences.english: They can be used to manufacture many products with high added-value.
sentences.chinese: 它们可以用来合成许多高附加值的产品。

sentences.english: Labor productivity is calculated by added value at current price.
sentences.chinese: 社会劳动生产率按现价增加值计算。

sentences.english: Outsource or automate the non-value adding part of HR.
sentences.chinese: 将没什么附加值的HR部分外包或自动化。

sentences.english: You gain a bonus to the damage rolls of arcane powers equal to your Dexterity modifier.
sentences.chinese: 你对奥法威能的伤害骰获得等同你的敏捷调整的加值。

sentences.english: Can you quantify the value added?
Indirect Estimation is made to the value-added of self-employed according to the tax data and the number of individual business.
sentences.chinese: 个体经营户增加值根据税收资料和清查户数间接推算。

sentences.english: In this case, their enhancement bonus applies to either type of attack.
sentences.chinese: 这种情况下，增强加值对两种攻击方式都有效。

sentences.english: Armor fashioned from ferroplasm bas a natural enhancement bonus to AC.
sentences.chinese: 星铁制成的防具在AC上有天生的增强加值。

sentences.english: The seamless pipe is produced as high additional value product.
sentences.chinese: 无缝管担当起开发高技术高附加值产品的重任。

sentences.english: Since the drum gear coupling is heavy and has higher added values, it is necessary to localize the manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 鼓形齿接轴重量大，附加值高，国产化生产十分必要。

sentences.english: Local value-addition, although low, is also bound to show increases in the future.
sentences.chinese: 本地附加值虽然低，但是在未来必将出现增加。

sentences.english: In value-added terms, the real share of exports is even smaller.
sentences.chinese: 从附加值的角度来看，出口所占的真实比重还要更小。

sentences.english: The project management activities represent economic costs on value-added engineering activities.
sentences.chinese: 专案管理活动表示加值型工程活动的经济成本。

definition: asset that gives a competitive advantage/a strength/(market) niche
laser (loanword used in Taiwan)/also written 鐳射|镭射
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
toy in a capsule (dispensed from a vending machine)
